snippet: The Securities and Futures Commission in Hong Kong, the world's biggest I.P.O. market, is seeking jail and fines for bankers that make false statements in a prospectus for a public offering.
abstract: The Securities and Futures Commission in Hong Kong, the world's biggest I.P.O. market, is seeking jail and fines for bankers that make false statements in a prospectus for a public offering.

headline.main: Hong Kong Regulator Seeks Penalties for I.P.O. Fraud
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Securities Regulator Seeks Penalties for I.P.O. Fraud
